alert.note: Alert for Bullitt; Grayson (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 25 at 9:16AM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1215 PM EDT/1115 AM CDT/ THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of NORTH CENTRAL Kentucky and SOUTH CENTRAL Kentucky, including the following counties, in NORTH CENTRAL Kentucky, Bullitt, Hardin, Larue and Meade. In SOUTH CENTRAL Kentucky, Grayson and Hart. * WHEN...Until 1215 PM EDT /1115 AM CDT/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 916 AM EDT /816 AM CDT/, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.8 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.3 to 0.8 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Elizabethtown, Radcliff, Vine Grove, Muldraugh, Upton, Sonora, Bonnieville, Addington Field Airport, Cecilia and Gaithers. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
